subject: Decisions and Verdicts
Tax Evasion
lead_paragraph: Jurors in Miami began deliberating Friday on tax evasion charges against the racecar driver Hélio Castroneves and two advisers. In closing arguments, prosecutors said Castroneves, his sister and business manager Katiucia Castroneves, and the Michigan lawyer Alan Miller conspired to evade millions in taxes. Jurors deliberated for about two and a half hours before adjourning until Monday morning. If convicted, Castroneves, his sister and Miller each could face more than six years in prison.
